comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: Could this be Major Harry Norman Fife Scott who served in the London Regiment?  Entries in the London Gazette show Captain H N Fife Scott appointed to 1st (City of London) Battalion London Regiment from the Territorial Army Reserve on 29 Sep 14 (LG 28941 of 16 Oct 14) and again on 7 Oct 1914 (LG of 20 Oct 1914).  Captain Fife-Scott went to 8th Battalion London Regiment (Post Office Rifles) on 23 Mar 1915 (LG 29139 of 20 Apr 1915) was posted to be Assistant Commandant of a PoW Camp wef 5 Aug 1915 (LG 29274 of 24 Aug 1915) but restored to the Establishment of 1st Battalion London Regiment from 5 Aug 1915 (LG 29333 of 19 Oct 1915.  In that same London Gazette (29333) he was placed on the General List wef 5 Aug 1915.  In this photograph he is wearing the cap badge and collar dogs of the General Service Corps.  His Medal Record Card suggests that he survived the Great War and left the Army in 1920. //

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: Harry N Fife-Scott was the younger son (probably born 1868) of Fife John Scott a well-known Newcastle merchant. Harry and his older brother, John, joined the ranks of the British South Africa Company Police on 2nd December 1889. One of the medal ribbons that he is wearing is likely to be that for the British South Africa Company Medal 1890-97. In 1911 the Scott family, including Harry, appear to have been living in Paddington, London.//

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Scott Harry Norman birth registered 3rd quarter 1867 Newcastle Scott Harry Lloyd (!) marriage in Newcastle registered 2nd quarter 1905 otherwise Scott Harry N marriage registered 1st quarter 1918 to Smith in Faversham, Kent www.freebmd.org.uk

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: The Army Lists reveal that an H L Scott was commissioned as a Second Lieutenant into the Essex Regiment on 16 Nov 1904. On 25 Dec 1907 he was promoted to Lieutenant and on 27 Feb 1914 to Captain, in both instances he is shown as serving in the 2nd Battalion. On 7 Oct 1914 he was appointed Temporary Major and Second in Command of 10th (Service) Battalion Essex Regiment. Therefore he and the officer in the photograph above are not one in the same, and the regimental attribution for Harry Norman Fife Scott should read London Regiment and later General Service Corps, not Essex Regiment.//
